Introduction
FileSystem_FATFS_RTOS_FATFS003 App

Introduction

FatFs is a software module used to organize a storage medium. It abstracts the physical layer interfaces to the storage medium and provides the functionalities to manage user data more efficiently with files and directories. Embedded file system library (EFSL) and FatFs are two popular and freely available FAT libraries for developing small embedded systems. FatFs is a generic FAT file system module for small embedded systems that can be ported to any underlying hardware. It has been architected with separate layers for hardware accesses Some applications may directly use this App bypassing the Standard Library Wrapper App above it. User must mount the device first before doing any operations on the disk. Make File system api f_mkfs() takes long time to create file system on the disk using driver code. This is due to the fact that FAT file system erases and writes single block at a time. FATFS003 App is used in RTOS environment.ID's is used as a synchronization object.Please refer the link below for more information on the FAT FS Api's.

  1. http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/00index_e.html

Scope

FileSystem_FATFS_RTOS_FATFS003 App lies below the Standard Library App .FatFs module is completely separated from disk I/O layer. FatFs version R0.09 is used.It intergerates with Device Abstraction Layer to access the physical media in RTOS environment as shown below:

FATFS003_abbreviation

  1. FAT : File Allocation Table
  2. API: Application Program Interface
  3. GUI: Graphical User Interface
  4. RTOS: Real Time Operating System
  5. LLD: Low Level Driver
  6. ANSI: American National Standards Institutes
  7. DAL: Device Abstarction Layer

FATFS003_reference

  1. http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/00index_e.html

FATFS003_limitation

1. Only short filenames(11 chars) are supported by this filesystem.
